topics.body:
"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552098396368724127ae1100#post_552098396368724127ae1100
Tiger sharks have a special gland in their nose that senses electrical impulses. When you rub the nose while wearing a safety suit you generate friction causing the gland to essentially overload.  The overload fills the sharks brain with endorphins. You're basically giving the shark a massage
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff
